revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== Habitational surname, from {{m|en|Yarborough}} and {{m|en|Yarburgh}} in [[Lincolnshire]], from a compound of {{der|en|ang|eor√æe||earth}} + {{m|ang|burh||stronghold}}. ===Proper noun=== {{en-proper noun|s}} # {{surname|en|from=Old English}}. # {{place|en|unincorporated community|co/Quitman County|s/Mississippi|c/US}}. ====Statistics==== * According to the 2010 United States Census, ''Yarbrough'' is the 1441<sup>st</sup> most common surname in the United States, belonging to 24749 individuals. ''Yarbrough'' is most common among White (70.61%) and Black/African American (23.73%) individuals. ===Further reading=== * {{R:en:DAFN}}
